comment:
* Common configurations to create virtual input devices.
 *
 * @hide

variables.name: DEVICE_NAME_MAX_LENGTH
variables.comment:
* The maximum length of a device name (in bytes in UTF-8 encoding).
     *
     * This limitation comes directly from uinput.
     * See also UINPUT_MAX_NAME_SIZE in linux/uinput.h

variables.name: mVendorId
variables.comment: The vendor id uniquely identifies the company who manufactured the device.

variables.name: mProductId
variables.comment:
* The product id uniquely identifies which product within the address space of a given vendor,
     * identified by the device's vendor id.

variables.name: mAssociatedDisplayId
variables.comment: The associated display ID of the virtual input device.

variables.name: mInputDeviceName
variables.comment: The name of the virtual input device.

methods.name: public int getVendorId()
methods.comment:
* The vendor id uniquely identifies the company who manufactured the device.
     *
     * @see Builder#setVendorId(int) (int)

methods.name: public int getProductId()
methods.comment:
* The product id uniquely identifies which product within the address space of a given vendor,
     * identified by the device's vendor id.
     *
     * @see Builder#setProductId(int)

methods.name: public int getAssociatedDisplayId()
methods.comment:
* The associated display ID of the virtual input device.
     *
     * @see Builder#setAssociatedDisplayId(int)

methods.name: public String getInputDeviceName()
methods.comment:
* The name of the virtual input device.
     *
     * @see Builder#setInputDeviceName(String)

methods.name: void writeToParcel(@NonNull Parcel dest, int flags)

methodNames: void writeToParcel(@NonNull Parcel dest, int flags)
